channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/05/2023 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL Express LIC facility, located at 12-12 33rd Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11106. Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN1266, Perfumery products, 1263, Paint, 1944 Matches, safety Class 3 Class 3, Class 4.1 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Bottle Packaging Type: Bottle Packaging Type: Book Material of Construction: Glass Material of Construction: Glass Material of Construction: Paper Package Capacity: 10 mL Package Capacity: 15 mi Package Capacity: 20 g Amount in Package: 10mL Amount in Package: 15 mi Amount in Package: 20 g Number in Shipment: 1 Number in Shipment: 5 Number in Shipment: 2 Number Failed: 1 Number Failed: 5 Number Failed: 2

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on the QA TABLE. The cap on the bottle was then tighten to prevent spillage. DescribePack: the cap on the bottle was loose causing leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was brought away from the area

item.title: Report X-2023120405
item.description:
Report X-2023120405

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: WEST HENRIETTA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Inbound manager noticed the damaged hazmat in the unload and informed QA to start the damaged hazmat process. DescribePack: Loose caps on the inner packages caused the liquid to leak within the box and onto the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately contained into a damaged salvage drum to be inspected and processed.

item.title: Report X-2023120285
item.description:
Report X-2023120285

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 10:20pm QA was called by the smalls manager to the unload bridge because a corrosive hazmat plastic pail was leaking on the IC belt. I brought a red hazmat bin, gloves, hazmat bag and towels to retrieve the hazmat and clean up the spill on the IC belt. DescribePack: The plastic pail got punctured on the bottom and leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I brought a red hazmat bin, gloves, hazmat bag and towels to retrieve the hazmat and clean up the spill on the IC belt.
